1.title: All in the Family
1.plot: After years in syndication in the United States, the 70's classic television hit "All in the Family" gets an Indian makeover, replete with kurtas, kameezes, and a brand new spanking opening theme.

2.title: Pirates
2.plot: Brenda ends her six-week fling with Taj, an overseas telemarketer who has been donning a pirate persona to fulfill her sexual fetish.

3.title: Indian Superheroes (The MisAdventures of Masala Man)
3.plot: A hapless superhero of condiments and spices tries to save a family's otherwise bland dinner after flying into their home and interrupting their meal.

1.title: Christopher Walken
1.plot: Randy is a British actor with the opportunity to land the role of a lifetime. But the only way he can get it is if he can pull off a convincing American accent. Unfortunately, he calls Tony: an acting coach with questionable credentials.

2.title: Inuit
2.plot: Kinguyakkii and Tekkeitsertok are two fun-loving dudes living on the tundra. There's not much to do in the Arctic so most of their time is spent fishing and talking crap.

3.title: Asian
3.plot: Daniel and Sitikantha were switched at birth. Daniel grew up as a Chinese man trapped in an Indian man's body and Sitikantha as a Chinese man raised by Indians. 30 years later they meet, with Daniel determined to take his life back.

4.title: Popes
4.plot: Pope Benedict is spending his retirement hanging out at Europe's largest gay bath house, purchased by the Vatican. Unfortunately, his day is interrupted by Pope Francis, who comes down to ask his advice on how to run his papacy.

5.title: Simon & Garfunkel
5.plot: Aspiring musical duo and cover band, Arty and Pauly have some very different ideas about the meaning behind a classic song by Simon & Garfunkel.

imdb.plot outline: Back in the early 2000s, there was a comedy troupe named Mixed Nuts. It played sold out shows and garnered rave reviews. What was unique about the troupe was that it featured a very multicultural cast that did every accent or character under the sun. The goal was to push minorities (South Asian) into the mainstream. It's obviously happened in the interim, but one thing that has remained missing is showcasing the ability to do voices beyond East Indian, Arabic (thanks for all the wonderful terrorist roles btw) or regular North American. That's where "Brown Guys Do" steps in. It shows that people of colour have a range of talent to do accents and characters beyond those typically associated with their race or background.
imdb.title: Brown Guys Do
plot: _Brown Guys Do_ (qv) showcases the ability of darkies to do voices beyond East Indian, Arabic or regular North American through various situational comedy performances.::_Brown Guys Do_ (qv)
